meanings.definition: A person who reasons with clever but fallacious arguments.
meanings.sent1: The sophists in the debate used tricky arguments to confuse the audience.
meanings.sent2: She was known as a sophist because she always tried to win arguments with clever but false reasoning.
meanings.sent3: The sophists at the party had everyone laughing with their silly arguments.
meanings.sent4: His reputation as a sophist made him a formidable opponent in debates.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the sophist's smooth talk; it may not always be truthful.

meanings.definition: A group of ancient Greek philosophers who emphasized the use of rhetoric and argumentation.
meanings.sent1: The sophists of ancient Greece were skilled in the art of persuasion.
meanings.sent2: Many students sought to learn from the sophists to improve their debating skills.
meanings.sent3: The sophists gathered under the olive tree to discuss their latest theories.
meanings.sent4: In the marketplace, the sophists' voices could be heard arguing passionately.
meanings.sent5: The teachings of the sophists influenced the development of Western philosophy.
